channel.title: Data Analysis II on USP 654 Fall 2017
channel.description: Recent content in Data Analysis II on USP 654 Fall 2017

item.description: Note: The schedule of topics and assignments might be subject to change. Date Lesson Reading Assignment Lecture Lab Part 1: Introduction & Data Analysis Workflow 09/25 Introduction and Data Analysis Workflow Part 2: Linear Regression 10/02 Bivariate Regression 10/09 DEADLINE: Project proposal 10/09 Multiple Regression (1) 10/16 Multiple Regression (2) 10/23 Dummy Variables 10/30 Interactions 11/06 Non-Linear Relationship, Indirect Effects and Omitted Variable Bias 11/13 DEADLINE: Project update 11/13 Outliers, Heteroskedasticity, and Multicollinearity 11/17 DEADLINE: Assignment 2 Part 3: Generalized Linear Models 11/20 Generalized Linear Models I 11/27 Generalized Linear Models; Where to go next 12/4 DEADLINE: Project Presentation 12/8 DEADLINE: Project Report

item.title: Policies
item.description: Grading: 3 homework assignments and the class project+paper will make up your entire grade in the course. I use these grading cutoffs: A=90% B=80% C=70% D=60% F<60% Notes If my office hours conflict with your schedule, send me a Google calendar invite for an appointment. Submit in your homework assignments to D2L/Assignments. Extensions on homework due dates will only be granted in exceptional circumstances and only if I am contacted before the due date.

item.title: Tools & Datasets
item.description: Tools R + RStudio R is the statistical programming language we will use in this class. We will interface with R using RStudio, a fully feautred IDE. Installing them on your own computer should be straightforward. If you already have them installed on your computer, I recommend you check the version and upgrade them to the latest version. Ask me for help if you have any problem installing them. Download and install R 3.
